prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Shape Information The first part is a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The hole is slightly larger than the width of the prism. The prism is positioned at an angle, with the cylindrical hole facing towards the viewer. The prism is slightly tilted to the right. The dimensions of this part are: - Length: 0.7332 (rounded to three decimal places) - Width: 0.7332 (rounded to three decimal places) - Height: 0.2206 (rounded to three decimal places) Coordinate System 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following Euler angles: 0.0, 0.0, and 0.0. 2. Create a translation vector of 0.0168, 0.0, and 0.0. Sketch 1. Face 1 a. Loop 1 i. Draw a line connecting point (0.0008, 0.2118) and (0.1596, 0.0). ii. Draw a line connecting point (0.1596, 0.0) and (0.7332, 0.0). iii. Draw a line connecting point (0.7332, 0.0) and (0.7332, 0.1324). iv. Draw a line connecting point (0.7332, 0.1324) and (0.0999, 0.3482). v. Draw an arc connecting point (0.0999, 0.3482), a mid-point at (0.0, 0.3165), and ending point at (0.0008, 0.2118). b. Loop 2 i. Draw a circle with a center at (0.0714, 0.2647) and a radius of 0.0551. c. Loop 3 i. Draw a circle with a center at (0.2302, 0.2471) and a radius of 0.0265. d. Loop 4 i. Draw a circle with a center at (0.2567, 0.0882) and a radius of 0.0265. e. Loop 5 i. Draw a circle with a center at (0.4508, 0.0882) and a radius of 0.0265. f. Loop 6 i. Draw a circle with a center at (0.6449, 0.0882) and a radius of 0.0265. g. Ensure all loops are closed. Extrusion 1. Set the extrude depth along the normal axis to 0.2206. 2. Set the extrude depth along the opposite normal axis to 0.0. 3. Set the sketch_scale to 0.7332. 4. Perform the New Body operation for this part.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. **Step 1: Create a new coordinate system** Set the Euler angles to (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) and the Translation Vector to (0.0, 0.1303, 0.0). **Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch** On the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system, draw a rectangle by creating four lines. * Line 1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0), End Point (0.1323, 0.0) * Line 2: Start Point (0.1323, 0.0), End Point (0.1323, 0.1829) * Line 3: Start Point (0.1323, 0.1829), End Point (0.0, 0.1829) * Line 4: Start Point (0.0, 0.1829), End Point (0.0, 0.0) **Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch** Scale the 2D sketch with a scaling factor of 0.1829. **Step 4: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D** Transform and rotate the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the following euler angles and translation vector: * Euler Angles: 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 * Translation Vector: 0.0, 0.1303, 0.0 **Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model** Extrude the 2D sketch to a depth of 0.1303 in the direction of the normal, resulting in a 3D model with a flat top and bottom. Part 2: Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. **Step 1: Create a new coordinate system** Set the Euler angles to (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) and the Translation Vector to (0.378, 0.1303, 0.3167). **Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch** On the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system, draw a circle with the following properties: * Center: (0.186, 0.186) * Radius: 0.186 **Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch** Scale the 2D sketch with a scaling factor of 0.372. **Step 4: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D** Transform and rotate the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the following euler angles and translation vector: * Euler Angles: 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 * Translation Vector: 0.378, 0.1303, 0.3167 **Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model** Extrude the 2D sketch to a depth of 0.1303 in the direction of the normal, resulting in a 3D model with a flat top and bottom and a slightly tapered middle section. Final Shape In the final CAD assembly, the two intermediate parts are positioned centrally against a white background, with the first part having a length, width, and height of approximately 0.183, 0.13, and 0.183 respectively, and the second part having a length, width, and height of approximately 0.372, 0.13, and 0.372 respectively.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1 Instructions** Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are approximately 0.72 x 0.72 x 0.0085 units. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.017, 0.017, 0.0] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. 3. Construct a rectangle by drawing four lines with the following endpoints: - Line 1: (0.0, 0.0) to (0.7159, 0.0) - Line 2: (0.7159, 0.0) to (0.7159, 0.4261) - Line 3: (0.7159, 0.4261) to (0.0, 0.4261) - Line 4: (0.0, 0.4261) to (0.0, 0.0) 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.7159. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction with a depth of 0.0085 units. This will create the 3D model of the part. **Part 2 Instructions** Construct a simple, two-dimensional, rectangular shape with a pointed end. The overall dimensions of the part are approximately 0.75 x 0.75 x 0.0085 units. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. 3. Construct the outer rectangle by drawing four lines with the following endpoints: - Line 1: (0.0, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0) - Line 2: (0.75, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.4602) - Line 3: (0.75, 0.4602) to (0.0, 0.4602) - Line 4: (0.0, 0.4602) to (0.0, 0.0) 4. Add two circles to the sketch at the following locations: - Circle 1: Center (0.0085, 0.2301), Radius 0.0064 - Circle 2: Center (0.7415, 0.2301), Radius 0.0064 5. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 6. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 7. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction with a depth of 0.0085 units. This will create the 3D model of the part. Note: These instructions assume that the designer is using the given CAD Assembly JSON to generate each part's corresponding CAD model. The instructions focus on the curves, loops, faces, and scaling information needed to create each part accurately. No additional assumptions have been made.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1 Instructions** Construct a CAD model of a simple mechanical component with two circular holes on opposite sides, connected by a straight line. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at origin (0, 0, 0) with no rotation. **Sketch Face 1** * Loop 1: 1. Draw a line from point (0.0949, 0.0622) to point (0.3272, 0.0212). 2. Draw an arc from point (0.3272, 0.0212) to point (0.4177, 0.0212) with mid point at (0.3724, 0). 3. Draw a line from point (0.4177, 0.0212) to point (0.65, 0.0622). 4. Draw an arc from point (0.65, 0.0622) to point (0.6068, 0.2471) with mid point at (0.7449, 0.1819). 5. Draw a line from point (0.6068, 0.2471) to point (0.1381, 0.2471). 6. Draw an arc from point (0.1381, 0.2471) to point (0.0949, 0.0622) with mid point at (0, 0.1819). * Loop 2: 1. Draw a circle centered at (0.0949, 0.1597) with radius 0.0807. * Loop 3: 1. Draw a circle centered at (0.3724, 0.0588) with radius 0.042. * Loop 4: 1. Draw a circle centered at (0.65, 0.1597) with radius 0.0807. **Extrusion** * Extrude the sketch along the normal direction by 0.084 units. * Apply a scale factor of 0.7449 to the sketch before extrusion. **Part 2 Instructions** Construct two cylinders with a smaller cylinder on top of each. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at point (0.2271, 0.0689, 0.084) with no rotation. **Sketch Face 1** * Create a circular loop at point (0.0134, 0.0134) with radius 0.0134. **Sketch Face 2** * Create a circular loop at point (0.0134, 0.0908) with radius 0.0134. **Sketch Face 3** * Create a circular loop at point (0.2824, 0.0134) with radius 0.0134. **Sketch Face 4** * Create a circular loop at point (0.2824, 0.0908) with radius 0.0134. **Extrusion** * Extrude each sketch face in the opposite direction of the normal by 0.0168 units. * Apply a scale factor of 0.2958 to each sketch before extrusion. **Final Shape** The final shape is a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, connected by a cylindrical section. It has a central hole and is slightly tapered towards the bottom. * The overall dimensions of the shape are as follows: - Length: 0.7449 units - Width: 0.7449 units - Height: 0.1848 units (including the top and bottom flat surfaces).</description>
